content.description: The first Crux is climbing the bulge past the first bolt and gaining the large ledge, the second crux is at the second bolt gaining the small ledge while avoiding the large loose flake.
content.protection: Two Bolts and a #2 BD Camalot.
content.location: Immediately to the right of "Old Chimney" and to the left of "Dead Tree.

content.description: Climb the dirty Chimney immediately to the left of "Run Out of Favors" and 15' to the left of "Dead Tree".
content.location: The Dirty Chimney to the left of "Run Out Of Favors".

climbs.name: Obnoxious Partner Crack
climbs.fa: Chuck Montague and Bart Pinello, circa 1973

content.description: Apparently a classic for the area.  Follows the obvious overhanging fist crack to a pod.  Then an airy step and up to the top.
content.protection: I sewed the thing up with as I remember a .5, .4, .75,  #1, 2 #2s and 2 #3s. Could get by on way less. Tons of good cam placements.There are four bolts in the ground at the top for anchoring, you’ll need maybe 30 feet or so of static line.
content.location: The next face to the left of Phone Booth.  When you're looking at the face, it's the super obvious fist crack through a bulge about 15 feet off the ground.(photo coming soon)

content.description: The crux is only a couple moves in, and to the left of the Dead Tree traverse section. It usually takes some sort of heel hook variation to get up to the ledge. You can either follow the obvious crack up to a tree, or stem back right on top of the overhang to finish the climb. Avoiding the crack and going right makes for a more challenging ending and leads to two anchor bolts.
content.protection: Two anchor bolts next to the trees used to top rope Obnoxious Partner Crack.
content.location: Use the same initial start as Dead Tree but try to stay left and avoid the finger crack in the corner. Approach the "overhanging" section on the left.

climbs.name: Dead Tree
climbs.fa: Tom Chianese and Jim Henry, Oct 10, 1977

content.description: Starts a little left of Obnoxious Partner crack. Climb right-facing corner under a roof, traverse left past it, and up to a ledge. Climb a crack up to a cedar tree belay.
Obnoxious Partner is the face with a fist width crack through a roof.
